thread.title: HotSpot Episode 129 - An App That Lets You “See” Digital Networks
thread.title_full: HotSpot Episode 129 - An App That Lets You “See” Digital Networks

author: sgoncalves
title: HotSpot Episode 129 - An App That Lets You “See” Digital Networks
text:
HotSpot Episode 129 - An App That Lets You “See” Digital Networks 53 min ago by Jon Dipierro, Sarah Goncalves, Janine E. Mooney, Eric Sorensen 
This week on WDD's Hotspot: 
An App That Lets You “See” the Hidden World of Digital Networks 
The Architecture of Radio is a new, site-specific iPad application that visualizes the invisible network of data cables and radio signals around us. 
Jeans, With A Side of Phone Charger 
Finding a charger and a power outlet can be a real pain, especially if you're in a bind. So why not incorporate a charger in your pants? That's exactly what Joe's Jeans has done with their newly designed #Hello smart jeans. 
“Smart” Palm Trees Double as Wi-Fi Hot Spots, Charging Stations 
These “smart” trees were designed to harness the sun’s power, but not for photosynthesis. Instead, they offer free Wi-Fi and power to beach goers in Dubai, India. 
Smart LED light bulb makes waking up easier 
Inspired by clinical sleep research, The Up Light is a smart bulb that helps you wake up naturally, feeling refreshed. And all you need to do is change a light bulb.
